Intervention: Watchful waiting (standard treatment). Study participants received no intervention and were monitored for development of radiation-induced fibrosis.
Combined treatment with Pentoxifylline and Vitamin E.
Vitamin E : Vitamin E (Over-the-counter) 400 I.U. once daily
Pentoxifylline : Pentoxifylline 400 mg, 3 times daily for 7 months, beginning immediately after radiation therapy.
Eligibility: Patients with histologically documented cancer of the breast or DCIS or head and neck referred for definitive radiation with curative intent.
Minimum life expectancy of at least 12 months.
No documented history of collagen vascular disease.
Life expectance of less than 12 months.
Results: Subjective, Objective, Management, and Analytic (SOMA) Score

A primary outcome of interest is the composite Subjective, Objective, Management, and Analytic (SOMA) score at 18-month follow-up visit. Maximum score is 45, with a score of 0 being ideal and representing no treatment-related side effects at the study visit.
Arm/Group Description: Watchful waiting (standard treatment). Study participants received no intervention and were monitored for development of radiation-induced fibrosis.
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  1.59         (1.53)
Arm/Group Title: Intervention: Pentoxifylline & Vitamin E
Arm/Group Description: Combined treatment with Pentoxifylline and Vitamin E.
Vitamin E : Vitamin E (Over-the-counter) 400 I.U. once daily
Pentoxifylline : Pentoxifylline 400 mg, 3 times daily for 7 months, beginning immediately after radiation therapy.
Unit of Measure: units on a scale  1.0         (1.19)
